text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5deeb3f1f9db4eabd36e99cbf857fe376eb37e10|patch 8.2.0512: Vim9: no optional arguments in func type>
patch 8.2.0512: Vim9: no optional arguments in func type

Problem:    Vim9: no optional arguments in func type.
Solution:   Check for question mark after type.  Find function reference
            without function().

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0512: Vim9: no optional arguments in func type · vim/vim@5deeb3f
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0512: Vim9: no optional arguments in func type · vim/vim@5deeb3f
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: no optional arguments in func type. Solution: Check for question mark after type. Find function reference without function().

patch 8.2.0513: reading past allocate memory when using varargs

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/bdff012f4416c75e65950a19688533c4def5abf6|patch 8.2.0514: several global functions are used in only one file>
patch 8.2.0514: several global functions are used in only one file

Problem:    Several global functions are used in only one file.
Solution:   Make the functions static. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #5884)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0514: several global functions are used in only one file · vim/vim@bdff012
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0514: several global functions are used in only one file · vim/vim@bdff012
attachments.text: Problem: Several global functions are used in only one file. Solution: Make the functions static. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #5884)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b8ed3aa9e708ec0af4e9ee8921ad198f0e949c0d|patch 8.2.0515: some compilers cannot add to "void *">
patch 8.2.0515: some compilers cannot add to "void *"

Problem:    Some compilers cannot add to "void *".
Solution:   Cast to "char *".

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0515: some compilers cannot add to "void *" · vim/vim@b8ed3aa
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0515: some compilers cannot add to "void *" · vim/vim@b8ed3aa
attachments.text: Problem: Some compilers cannot add to "void *". Solution: Cast to "char *".

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f87a0400fd81862c33d6ad2291a56e178db7dddd|patch 8.2.0516: client-server code is spread out>
patch 8.2.0516: client-server code is spread out

Problem:    Client-server code is spread out.
Solution:   Move client-server code to a new file. (Yegappan Lakshmanan,
            closes #5885)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0516: client-server code is spread out · vim/vim@f87a040

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4c68375057c25e99656bc996d3fa5c6b0b6a7e6a|patch 8.2.0517: Vim9: cannot separate "func" and "func(): void">
patch 8.2.0517: Vim9: cannot separate "func" and "func(): void"

Problem:    Vim9: cannot separate "func" and "func(): void".
Solution:   Use VAR_ANY for "any" and VAR_UNKNOWN for "no type".

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0517: Vim9: cannot separate "func" and "func(): void" · vim/vim@4c68375
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0517: Vim9: cannot separate "func" and "func(): void" · vim/vim@4c68375
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot separate "func" and "func(): void". Solution: Use VAR_ANY for "any" and VAR_UNKNOWN for "no type".

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5ba8d3578c835edcfb7e3b132e623c12e62f250b|patch 8.2.0518: a terminal falls back to setting $TERM to "xterm">
patch 8.2.0518: a terminal falls back to setting $TERM to "xterm"

Problem:    A terminal falls back to setting $TERM to "xterm".
Solution:   Use "xterm-color" if more than 16 colors are supported and
            "xterm-256color" if at least 256 colors are supported.
            (closes #5887)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0518: a terminal falls back to setting $TERM to "xterm" · vim/vim@5ba8d35
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0518: a terminal falls back to setting $TERM to "xterm" · vim/vim@5ba8d35
attachments.text: Problem: A terminal falls back to setting $TERM to &quot;xterm&quot;. Solution: Use &quot;xterm-color&quot; if more than 16 colors are supported and &quot;xterm-256color&quot; if a...
